decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Kroxa, Goldspan Dragon, and Bonecrusher Giant to quickly pressure the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Heartless Act and Shatterskull Smashing. Valki, God of Lies provides additional value by either copying a powerful creature or providing card advantage. The deck also includes a reanimation strategy with Tymaret Calls the Dead and Egon, God of Death. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and disruption, while also having the ability to generate card advantage and grind out longer games.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Goldspan Dragon, and Lovestruck Beast alongside efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Edgewall Innkeeper provide card advantage and additional value to keep up the pressure. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of Mountains, Forests, and dual lands for consistency.

The main strategy of this Naya Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence using efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Kazandu Mammoth, and then finish off the opponent with powerful combat tricks like Embercleave and Raking Claws. Key cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Showdown of the Skalds provide card advantage to keep the momentum going. The deck also includes some removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and card advantage.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient cards to apply pressure on the opponent quickly and disrupt their game plan. By combining powerful creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Bonecrusher Giant with removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Claim the Firstborn, it aims to control the board and deal damage fast. The deck also includes cards like Tymaret Calls the Dead and Village Rites for card advantage and to maintain momentum. By maintaining a strong board presence and utilizing efficient removal, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while attacking their library with mill effects. Using cards like Ruin Crab and Into the Story, you can quickly deplete the opponent's deck while controlling the board with spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act. Lurrus of the Dream-Den gives you extra value by allowing you to replay low-cost creatures from your graveyard. Overall, this Dimir Control deck aims to outlast the opponent by controlling the field and depleting their resources through mill effects.

This deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells and counterspells to control the game, while also generating card advantage through card draw effects. It utilizes powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Valki, God of Lies to apply pressure on the opponent, while also having versatile threats like Shark Typhoon and Brazen Borrower. The mana base is built to ensure consistent access to all colors, with utility lands like Field of Ruin for additional disruption. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and grind out incremental advantages until it can secure a win.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to neutralize threats from the opponent while establishing control through removal spells and counterspells. By utilizing cards like Binding the Old Gods, Heartless Act, and Saw It Coming, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board. Koma, Cosmos Serpent provides a powerful win condition while Ashiok, Nightmare Muse offers additional disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with its control elements and eventually overwhelm them with powerful threats like Koma or Shark Typhoon.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to maintain board advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategies. With a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw engines, the deck aims to survive the early game and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and versatile options. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games. The deck also features a variety of ramp spells to ensure consistent land drops and access to powerful late-game plays.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing mill and disruption tactics to control the game and outvalue opponents. By combining cards like Ruin Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while gradually milling their deck. Soaring Thought-Thief and Into the Story provide additional card advantage, while Lullmage's Domination and Agadeem's Awakening offer powerful late-game plays. The deck's mana base is optimized to support both its control elements and graveyard-centric strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It aims to survive the early game with cheap removal spells like Frost Bite and Bonecrusher Giant, disrupt opponents' plans with counterspells like Saw It Coming and Negate, and ultimately win the game with strong finishers like Goldspan Dragon and Shark Typhoon. The deck also utilizes versatile lands like Faceless Haven and Fabled Passage to ensure consistent mana base and access to different colors.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control elements to disrupt opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through sacrifice and card draw effects. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Claim the Firstborn, while also generating value with Village Rites and Woe Strider. The deck also includes powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King to pressure opponents. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional mana ramp and consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using a mix of creatures and equipment to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Skyclave Apparition along with versatile equipment like Maul of the Skyclaves to deal damage efficiently. Showdown of the Skalds helps refill the hand and put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Dire Tactics to deal with threats. With a strong mana base and a mix of creatures and equipment, this deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive attacks and removal.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent. It includes powerful creatures such as Questing Beast, Vorinclex, and Lovestruck Beast, along with support cards like Gemrazer and Primal Might. The deck utilizes ramp cards like Kazandu Mammoth and Tangled Florahedron to ensure a steady stream of threats. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain, while Vivien, Monsters' Advocate offers versatility in creature selection. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggression and disruption by utilizing powerful creatures like Kroxa and Immersturm Predator alongside removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Heartless Act. The deck aims to put early pressure on the opponent with fast creatures and efficient removal spells, while also utilizing sacrifice effects like Village Rites and Claim the Firstborn to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Valki, God of Lies adds versatility and disruption to the deck, making it a formidable force in Standard 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Extinction Event, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse, the deck aims to keep the opponent's board clear while generating card advantage. With the help of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck also has the ability to flicker permanents for additional value. By managing resources efficiently and out-valuing the opponent, this Sultai Control deck aims to grind out victories in a long game.

The deck focuses on building a wide board presence of small, aggressive creatures while also enhancing their power through anthem effects. It includes cards like Glorious Anthem and Basri Ket to boost their creatures, along with cards like Selfless Savior and Giant Killer to protect them. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of quick, efficient creatures and finish the game before the opponent can set up their defenses. It also includes a few utility lands like Faceless Haven and Castle Ardenvale for additional flexibility.
